did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.repository: Special Collections, Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University, Blacksburg, Va.
did.unittitle: New England Press Association Photo Album 1880-81
did.abstract: Large scrapbook with 64 mounted photographs and descriptions.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: New England Press Association Photo Album, Ms91-024, Special Collections, Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University, Blacksburg, Va.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired from Norfolk Southern on April 19, 1991.

altformavail.head: Alternative Form Available
altformavail.p: Digital images available on the VT Imagebase.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical Information
bioghist.p: The New England Press Association was formed in the late 1860s from the Boston Press Association, which later merged into the Associated Press in 1897.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of one large scrapbook with 64 mounted photographs, along with descriptions of each photograph. Photographs include depictions of the Agriculture Department Building in Washington, D.C., scenes in Elizabethtown, Tennessee, views of the East Tennessee and North Carolina Railroad, Cranberry Iron Works in North Carolina, and views of and from the East Tennessee Virginia and Georgia Express Train.

The scrapbook also includes photographs of the house of William Hicks Jackson, Brigadier General of all Tennessee Cavalry and the Texas Brigade. Prior to this service, Jackson was the Confederate Captain of the artillery, then Colonel of the 7th Tennessee and 1st Mississippi.

Also included are photographs of James Polk's former residence in Nashville, Tennessee, the Tennessee State Capital Building, group pictures of the New England Press Association in Chattanooga, Tennessee, wreck of the East Tennessee, Virginia, and Georgia Railroad at Rock Bridge, Tennessee, Natrual Bridge, Virginia, Luray Cavern, and the Antietam Civil War battle site.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is arranged according to subject matter.
